subject: Probability
title: The Famous Monty Hall Problem
description: The Monty Hall problem is a famous probability puzzle that has a counterintuitive solution. Applications of the law of total probability (Bayesian probability theory) can often result in surprising conclusions when analyzed from different viewpoints. This article provides an overview of the Monty Hall problem, demonstrates the counterintuitive solution, and explains the reasoning behind the solution using Bayesian probability theory.
objectives: Provide an overview of the Monty Hall problem
Demonstrate the counterintuitive solution to the problem
Explain the reasoning behind the solution using Bayesian probability theory
